alert.note: Alert for Eastern Pima-Southeastern Pinal-Santa Cruz-Western Cochise; Mountains above 5500 feet; Northern Graham-Northern Greenlee-White and Gila Mountains; Southern Graham-Central and Eastern Cochise-Southern Greenlee-Lower Elevations of the San Carlos Apache Nation in Graham County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 09 at 3:51AM MST until May 10 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG AND GUSTY SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND A HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 151 AND 152 AND BELOW 7,000 FEET IN PARTS OF ZONES 153 AND 154... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones, most of 151 and 152, and below 7,000 feet for zones 153 and 154. * TIMING...Late Wednesday morning into Wednesday evening. * WINDS...Southwest to west 20 to 25 mph with gusts to around 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity level of 8 to 14 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop or are ongoing will have the potential to spread rapidly. * FOR A DETAILED VIEW OF THE HAZARD AREA...Visit weather.gov/Tucson and click on the Detailed Hazards Icon.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of the Fire Weather Watch for portions of Southeast Arizona.
